storyInfo: A teacher—Fischer in disguise—evacuates a group of children from the Sarkaz blockade. Little do they even know, their beloved teacher will never return again.

attributes.content: Crown Grove Primary School, rebuilt postwar Londinium, 1099
Welcome back to school, students and teachers alike. The war couldn't take you, which can only mean you're stronger for it. Now, get stuck in! You're the ones who'll bring the shine back to Victoria!
attributes.name: Broadcast

attributes.content: Susan! Laura! Reeves! Cor, I never thought I'd see any of you again! Go on, get your arms around me, I can take it!
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Student

attributes.content: Billy? You get in here too! Stop sitting in the corner with your paper, Granddad!
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Student

attributes.content: We put a clear date on the start of term announcement, and the name of the school is right there front and center... Could he have not seen it...?
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: What are you just mumbling for?
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Student

attributes.content: Forget that actually, anyone see Mr. Conrad? He's always bang on time; now lessons are going to start without him. Is he lost?
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Student

attributes.content: Ahem. Nice to meet you, children. I'm Ms. Louise, and I'll be your new teacher.
attributes.name: New Teacher

attributes.content: Ms. Louise? What happened to Mr. Conrad?
attributes.name: Mischievous Student

attributes.content: Erm... sorry, I've not heard of anyone by that name.
attributes.name: New Teacher

attributes.content: Yeah you have! Mr. Conrad, spelt like C-O-N... R-A-D. No flipping way he'd abandon us, ever.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Student

attributes.content: He said he wasn't like the rest of our subs, he was gonna stick around.
attributes.name: Mischievous Student

attributes.content: I'm... fairly aware of what happened here. If I'm right, most of your teachers weren't willing to stay when the Sarkaz locked this area down.
attributes.name: New Teacher

attributes.content: But things aren't like that now, and I'm thrilled to say I'll be with you all for a long time to come. Erm, hello there, is something the matter?
attributes.name: New Teacher

attributes.content: (Heaves silent sobs)
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: He's fine with you, Miss. It's just, Mr. Conrad was a really nice teacher to him. And actually, the whole class as well. But he thought he'd be coming back and he didn't.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Student

attributes.content: I knocked on the staff room just now and there's no trace of him anywhere, not even on the blackboard with the big teacher's timetable...
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: They printed about term starting in the newspaper and everything, and he still didn't show up...
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: Oh... I see. Then maybe I could get to know you all better by hearing about this Mr. Conrad. Can someone put up their hand and tell me what kind of person he is?
attributes.name: New Teacher

attributes.content: He LOVES being on time. And he's, like, grim-looking, but mad funny as well? Stop laughing at me, you know what I mean, right? He always tells jokes with a dead serious face.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Student

attributes.content: He can twirl knives! And his lessons are super sick!
attributes.name: Mischievous Student

attributes.content: ...He won't... keep a promise... *sob*...
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: Londinium, spring of 1098
You'll be bringing 'Engineer' back to us this time. At the moment, he's trapped within the Sarkaz blockade. We suspect he's still undercover.
attributes.name: Information Broker

attributes.content: His son, Billy, attends Crown Grove Primary. Which this says is still holding lessons as of now.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Everyone in that blockade is their neighbor's neighbor. If I'm going to make contact with the target, posing as his son's teacher won't be liable to rouse suspicion. Prepare me the appropriate identity, please.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: We do have one teacher identity still unused. Name of... Ian Conrad. That said—
attributes.name: Information Broker

attributes.content: Do you have any experience with children? Year 3 students can be harder to cope with than the devils at times. Be warned.
attributes.name: Information Broker

attributes.content: My MO is to avoid groups specialized in sowing chaos any way I can, but I can assure you, this is my job, and I'll be amply rehearsed.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: I trust you can do it. Side note—the place is on a knife's edge. The moment you retrieve the target, you pull out of there immediately.
attributes.name: Information Broker

attributes.content: Understood.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: The one and only target Fischer needs to watch, Billy, is sat quietly in a corner, nibbling away at his fingernails with gusto. This does not, however, suffice to ignore the nineteen other bombs going off in the classroom right now.
Let's bet how long until the new Sir does a runner. Ten pence says he's gone tomorrow!
attributes.name: Whispering Student

attributes.content: Oi, dumbarse! Stop using my notes in your catapult!
attributes.name: Note-Passing Student

attributes.content: I've got a stink bug; who's brave enough to drop it on a devil's head? Open the hatch—STINKBOMB! Wrmmm—
attributes.name: Bug-Watching Student

attributes.content: Settle down, class. Attention please.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Nice try, Sir, who are you anyway? We've had loads of teachers quit before you. Why don't you get out of here now?
attributes.name: Note-Passing Student

attributes.content: Hello, Selene. I don't plan to quit, but your head did just warn me that if your class keeps kicking up such a fuss, my position will be untenable.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Tha... That's just 'cuz you haven't been duffed by one of those drunk devils yet.
attributes.name: Selene

attributes.content: Oi... this is barmy, he knows your name! Are you two tight or something?
attributes.name: Hollering Student

attributes.content: This is our first time meeting, Madeline.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Watch out, Mr. Whatever! ...Cor, did you just catch that? That was a catapult! Fair dos.
attributes.name: Selene

attributes.content: Oi, give it back though, that's my note. You're not allowed to read what's in it.
attributes.name: Selene

attributes.content: What you and Danny are discussing about me doesn't interest me, but I can answer your questions. My dagger is the real thing, and no comment on how far I can chuck it.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: How come you knew...
attributes.name: Selene

attributes.content: Your eyes, movements, and even the words you're mouthing are undisguised. Gathering that information wasn't hard. If needed, I can say out loud what each and every person in the class is talking about right now.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Oh? You're all very quiet, now that I mention that. Wary, too.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: I almost forgot that when I was in school, I hated my teachers scrutinizing everything about me too. So, it's crucial you learn how to hide things—
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Eh? I wasn't... holding this note before?
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: To pass messages along under the enemy's nose, first you must shift their attention, like I did just now.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: I—I missed that! Do it again!
attributes.name: Selene

attributes.content: Has he got magic hands?!
attributes.name: Madeline

attributes.content: Magic has nothing to do with it. You can do it too, Billy.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Me? I...
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: Sir, why do you care about him so much? He's thick, he is.
attributes.name: Madeline

attributes.content: Unfortunately, Madeline, you could do with better observation.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: ...*clears throat*.
attributes.name: Madeline

attributes.content: I noticed that out of everyone here, Billy has the most nimble hand muscles by far, plus a level personality. He makes for the ideal operative.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Billy looks up at Mr. Conrad. In the teacher's gaze, he sees certainty, encouragement... or perhaps, it's probing him.
Uncertain of himself, he kneads at the newfound slip of paper. Fischer approaches him, and with a gentle hand, high-fives him.
And now it's in my hand. See, I told you you could do it.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: (Excited gasp)
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: Oi, Mr. Whatever—teach us some more! We promise we'll properly learn, right, everyone?
attributes.name: Selene

attributes.content: Ian Conrad.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: None of this is in your curriculum, but if it'll get you to calm down...
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Mm, no, the blockade being as it is, we can call this applied science.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Anyone interested, follow me outside to the playground.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Mr. Conrad...
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: Billy, please follow close to the other students.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Alright, let's walk together then.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Okay! My privilege, Mr. Conrad.
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: Another way to pass on information is using markers—a form of codeword only you and your compatriots will know the meaning of. You're familiar with the TV approach of drawing arrows on walls, which is the classical simpleton's method.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Your markers, on the other hand, should be founded in using the everyday objects that surround you, arranging them into forms only allies will take note of.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: As an example, create a triangle out of three stones, then just slightly adjust them, in such a way they could've naturally fallen like that.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Now, all of you try. But be careful not to leave the playground.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Mr. Conrad! Look at my super-duper unsuspicious leaf triangle!
attributes.name: Selene

attributes.content: You'll have to ask the weather not to be windy first, if you're going to use leaves.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Hahahaha! ...You're joking, right? Why aren't you laughing?
attributes.name: Selene

attributes.text: Look, check out my big tire triangle, it beats the pants off theirs!
Hey, Mr. Conrad, my marker's way easier to tell than his, innit?
Mr. Conrad? Did I do my marker right?
Mr. Conrad, Billy snuck out the wire fence! There's—there's devils outside!

attributes.content: Everyone, back to the classroom now. Selene, fetch the head.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Gosh, Billy, you left the safe zone? Don't you remember how strict they were about teaching the safe zone rules? Why did you do that?
attributes.name: New Teacher

attributes.content: Okay, what happened next?
attributes.name: New Teacher

attributes.content: ...I got Mr. Conrad beaten up.
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: He helped me up from the devils, and tried to negotiate with them, to get me away from them, but they...
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: Your voice is shaking. It's okay, if it hurts too much to remember, you don't have to.
attributes.name: New Teacher

attributes.content: I'm not scared of them now, I'm not anymore... Next the head came, 'cause the head knew the boss of those devils, and then they had to let me go even though they didn't want to...
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: Now you mention, we started getting on with Mr. Conrad all proper-like after that!
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Student

attributes.content: 'Cause he was like a massive hero to us, bringing Billy back.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Student

attributes.content: Yeah, yeah... We told him he can't quit like all the others, and we gave him a lifetime pass to all our kids' parties! 'Cause normally we have an age limit!
attributes.name: Mischievous Student

attributes.content: And he promised us, he did...
attributes.name: Mischievous Student

attributes.text: I won't leave you before my work is done.

attributes.content: Londinium, spring of 1098
Two Victorians stand in the shade on the side of the street, not a hair out of place, their chat so unassuming they could just as well have been a parent and teacher.

Mr. Conrad, Billy tells me you saved him from that mishap the other day. Said the only thing Sir asked of him afterwards was if he could meet me. Had me baffled at first. Nice to meet someone from the 'union.'
attributes.name: 'Engineer'

attributes.content: Allow me to give you my sincerest thanks.
attributes.name: 'Engineer'

attributes.content: But if your mission's to extract me from here—read that right, didn't I? Then I've other plans, sorry.
attributes.name: 'Engineer'

attributes.content: Billy can come with you.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Why do you think those devils are specifically letting a school still open its doors?
attributes.name: 'Engineer'

attributes.content: Because children make the best hostages. And pulling them all out of here is beyond my power.
attributes.name: 'Engineer'

attributes.content: Pass this on to the Duke of Caster if you would: The Sarkaz still don't know who I am; I'm just an ordinary engineer to them, and I've not flipped sides. I'm just choosing to stay.
attributes.name: 'Engineer'

attributes.content: If your orders are to silence me if you can't extract me, odds are I won't stand for that either—I've spent too long stewing here as is!
attributes.name: 'Engineer'

attributes.content: Calm down. There's no need for us to come to blows in the enemy's quarters. Think about Billy—
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Pssh. Let me look: what are you, twenty? Thirty? I've been plying this trade much longer than you. You may as well be reading me Verbal Manipulation for Dummies.
attributes.name: 'Engineer'

attributes.content: In fact, none of your 'branch's' methods are safe from me. Extending the extraction plans to Billy is stretching your charity to the limit. You can't afford greater faff than that, not with your standing.
attributes.name: 'Engineer'

attributes.content: You think you know how it turns out for the spies they catch. I know I know. So I'm not going to be asking too much of you.
attributes.name: 'Engineer'

attributes.content: Leave it for now. We talk about this any longer and they'll start wondering.
attributes.name: 'Engineer'

attributes.content: ...One thing, actually, because I'm curious. Billy won't open up to me why he left the safe zone that time, and that's not like him. He's always been the kind who likes to mind the rules.
attributes.name: 'Engineer'

attributes.content: We were in the middle of practicing how to leave markers. I'm a subpar teacher; the most I can do is impart on them what I know best.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: ...That explains it. He's taken to you. He's a piece of cake to you, relatively speaking, isn't he? One glance and you could tell your target was a boy in need of validation—just give it to him, and he'd latch right on.
attributes.name: 'Engineer'

attributes.content: I don't mean to pick bones with the job you do, I just want to tell you, the last thing my son is is troublemaking. He only wanted to try tailing the real enemy, make himself seem useful to you, leave a lasting impression on you.
attributes.name: 'Engineer'

attributes.content: Do you plan to follow me forever, Billy? You're free to practice leaving markers on your own.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: ...I was wondering if you need helping out, Mr. Conrad. My dad always says I'm good with helping out.
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: No rush, you can ask me again once you're more practiced.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Mr. Conrad, can you maybe not go after all; could you forget about quitting? Can you—can you stay with us, all the time?
attributes.name: Selene

attributes.content: I won't leave you before my work is done.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Leave the blockade, go on. Your job's done.
attributes.name: 'Engineer'

attributes.content: Please, stick to the evacuation as planned. People will be there to pick you up. As for your son...
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: There are some things a father can't do that a teacher can.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Reporting in, safe zone exit is all clear.
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: Good. Now, get into two lines side-by-side, and hold hands with the person next to you. The two in front, keep close to me, and don't move one step away.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: We're opting for a route with no lights, no human activity, and no chance the Sarkaz would take it themselves.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: We'll be crossing the Sarkaz encampment, but they won't notice us. You've all done tremendously well in my class, after all. Nobody will hear your footsteps.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Finally, there's a hole in their net that we'll slip the blockade through, until the enemy siege is behind us.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Do you remember how to count?
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Absolute focus, watch my feet. Every ten steps, count up one—count it in my head.
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: Once we've counted to a thousand, we've made it.
attributes.name: Selene

attributes.content: Then we're off.
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: One... two... three... four...
Fifty-one... fifty-two... fifty-three...
Two-hundred-and... thirty-three... two-hundred-and... thirty-four... two-hundred-and... thirty-five...
(Ungh!)
attributes.name: Student Tripped by Rock

attributes.content: (Stop.)
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Nothing happens. No one notices the noise here.
(Can you get up? Should I carry you?)
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: (I'm fine.)
attributes.name: Student Tripped by Rock

attributes.content: (Back onward.)
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Five-hundred-and... sixty-seven... five-hundred-and... sixty-eight... five-hundred-and... sixty-nine...

While weaving over wreckage, they lose their footing in a foul rubbish tip, sending startled musbeasts scattering in all directions. They don't let their lips open a peep, however, not daring to make a sound.
What was that noise? I heard some kind of stunt over there!
attributes.name: Alert Mercenary

attributes.content: (Shh.)
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: *Sarkaz profanity*! It's musbeasts! The hell did this many come from?!
attributes.name: Rowdy Mercenary

attributes.content: This is why I friggin' warned you about leaving your trash in the camp! I had ONE good pair of pants and goddamn musbeasts gnawed a hole in it!
attributes.name: Rowdy Mercenary

attributes.content: (Go.)
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: *huff*... *huff*...
(We're far enough now; it's relatively deserted out here. You can let out your breath a little, but we still can't afford to relax.)
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: (Let's see how many we are. Line up, everyone.)
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: (Are all of you doing alright?)
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: (Laura can't walk anymore.)
attributes.name: Student in the Darkness

attributes.content: (It's freezing, Mr. Conrad.)
attributes.name: Student in the Darkness

attributes.content: (I want to go home... I miss Mum and Dad...)
attributes.name: Student in the Darkness

attributes.content: (How far is it? Is it much longer?)
attributes.name: Student in the Darkness

attributes.content: (Not far now. Just be brave.)
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: (Alright. Let's go.)
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: (Mr. Conrad, can we sing a song while we walk? We've been walking forever, some of us are losing it.)
attributes.name: Student in the Darkness

attributes.content: (We can't.)
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: (But we're dying.)
attributes.name: Student in the Darkness

attributes.content: (Just a little longer.)
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: (...Then can we hold onto your hands, Mr. Conrad?)
attributes.name: Student in the Darkness

attributes.content: (...Very well, then.)
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: (There's a little bell on my little matchbox—ring-a-ling-a-ling, and a beep-beep-boo—)
attributes.name: Student in the Darkness

attributes.content: (See, no one can hear us when we're this quiet, and we can walk for miles more.)
attributes.name: Student in the Darkness

attributes.content: (Off to the fair in my little matchbox—ring-a-ling-a-ling and a beep-beep-boo—)
attributes.name: Student in the Darkness

attributes.content: (Park my little matchbox full in the boot—what have you got there, can I take a look?—ring-a-ling-a-ling and a beep-beep-boo—)
attributes.name: Student in the Darkness

attributes.content: The schoolchildren's song works a strange magic in the midst of the night. As more and more students join in, a few hums and mumbles turn into a whole chorus of hushes.
(Steady as she goes—it's like pea soup—ring-a-ling-a-ling and a beep-beep-boo—)
attributes.name: Student in the Darkness

attributes.content: (Hee-hee... ha-ha-ha...)
attributes.name: Student in the Darkness

attributes.content: (Mr. Conrad, you know, the tune is really smashing for this song, it's like ba-bang, ba-bang! It's really sad you don't get to hear. I could start singing it out loud any moment—)
attributes.name: Student in the Darkness

attributes.content: (...Once you're safe, you'll have the chance. Then you can sing it as loud as you want.)
attributes.name: Mr. Conrad

attributes.content: Mission target, and twenty children, delivered.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: ...Fischer, you could give me ten tries with my eyes closed and I'd still never guess you would fly in the face of reason like this.
attributes.name: Information Broker

attributes.content: Once I'd run the calculations and ruled out what risks I could, this was the optimum choice, and all their guardians gave permission. I also left their guardians to organize any follow-up action on their own, because I am no longer involved.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: And you don't get to be. I have your next assignment right here.
attributes.name: Information Broker

attributes.content: All particulars regarding Ian Conrad have been dealt with in the proper manner. Mission complete.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Now, I'll be getting my head-start. I leave the tying-up to you.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Mr. Conrad! Mr. Conrad, where are you? We can sing that song for you now!
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: I know how it goes after that. Once you left, a resistance movement erupted inside the blockade.
attributes.name: New Teacher

attributes.content: Which drove out the Sarkaz, but it's still very, very hard to call it a success. We can't ignore the sacrifices we made...
attributes.name: New Teacher

attributes.content: But when all hell broke loose, at least the damage here was as little as it could've been.
attributes.name: New Teacher

attributes.content: Still, I couldn't help noticing when you said twenty children were led to safety—is there a reason I'm only counting...
attributes.name: New Teacher

attributes.content: Look out there! The leaf pile outside the window, I'm not seeing things, right? I was staring off at it just before and now the shape's all different!
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Student

attributes.content: You can see the shape of the wind in the autumn leaves. You've got very sharp eyes to notice the way they fall.
attributes.name: New Teacher

attributes.content: No, it's him! I knew he'd come back!
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: The students spring to their feet one after another, half of them squeezing through the door, half choosing to climb straight through the window.
Bugger... I got all worked up for nothing, he's not anywhere here...
attributes.name: Mischievous Student

attributes.content: I can't find any other markers. You're joking me... was I really seeing things?
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Student

attributes.content: Oh, fudge, the wind! Now there's definitely no marker...
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Student

attributes.content: He promised not to quit, didn't he? He promised!
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: ...He's not the only one to abandon us.
attributes.name: Mischievous Student

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Student

attributes.content: ...Wait, you lot, look where the leaves were, that's those three stones he demonstrated with once!
attributes.name: Mischievous Student

attributes.content: MR. CONRAD—MR. CONRAD? Did he just come by and then do a runner again?
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Student

attributes.content: ♪There's a little bell on my little matchbox... ♪Ring-a-ling-a-ling and a beep-beep-boo...
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: Oi, what are you up to, Billy?
attributes.name: Mischievous Student

attributes.content: ♪Off to the fair in my little matchbox~ ♪Ring-a-ling-a-ling and a beep-beep-boo...
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: *sigh*. He's not gonna hear you like that.
attributes.name: Mischievous Student

attributes.content: (Takes a deep breath) ♪PARK MY LITTLE MATCHBOX FULL IN THE BOOT! ♪WHAT HAVE YOU GOT THERE, CAN I TAKE A LOOK!!! ♪RING-A-LING-A-LING, and a BEEP-BEEP-BOO!!!
attributes.name: Billy

attributes.content: We'll help out!
attributes.name: Mischievous Student

attributes.content: ♪Steady as she goes— ♪It's like pea soup— ♪Ring-a-ling-a-ling and a beep-beep-boo—
attributes.name: Chorus of Schoolchildren

attributes.content: ♪Steady as she goes, steady as she goes— ♪Then my matchbox tumbles and over she goes— ♪With a big old flip and a bing-bang-boo—
attributes.name: Chorus of Schoolchildren

attributes.content: *chuckle*... I see. What a lovely little tune.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: A good fit for today's Londinium.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Fischer takes a seat on a bench in the square. The children's song drifts guilelessly through the air from parts he can't set foot near, and he listens, and he takes in the sight of a rebuilt Londinium. This time, he's in no hurry to leave.
